simpledc.title: The Time of Our Lives
simpledc.creator: Mellor, David Hugh
simpledc.subject: Time
McTaggart
simpledc.description: The article shows how McTaggart’s distinction between A- and B-series ways of locating events in time prompted and enabled the twentieth century’s most important advances in the philosophy of time. It argues that, even if the B-series represents time as it really is, because having A-series beliefs when they are true is indispensable to the causation of timely action, the A-series represents ‘the time of our lives’.
